title: What are some examples for teaching philosophy? - Quora

response.answer_text: My favorites were all professors I met in person. My favorite philosophy teachers Did not dumb it down. They taught pure content that was nevertheless clear and coherent and challenged us to meet us there. It was invigorating.Gave excellent reading.Had amazing flow for their syllabus that answered to itself and really left you with a satisfying understanding.Were not there for prestige, attention, or money. They were there for philosophy and it showed in how they applied their philosophy to their occupation as well.Were inspiring because they really loved their subject and really understood its most advanced levels. I always did better in challenging classes. These are those are the types that would never speak an ill word on philosophy.Wanted you to engage and didn't enable unnecessary hand holding while still holding you at a stable positive regard of your competency with the perfect nudges. *I really appreciate that.*They seemed to have a magical sense of what resources you would need.
Please update the question with details if this not sufficient, but the link here gives quite a few along with explanations: Page on hccs.edu
